description.p: Purpose: Provides users with search capabilities of all objects in ownCloud and a simple user interface to interact with them.
Environment: Designed for ownCloud 5.0 and above. Search extends only to objects created by apps in the github 'app' repository; to make your objects available for search, see the Developers section.
Domain: The app only interacts with search providers extending OC_Search_Provider and search results extending OC_Search_Result.
Technologies: The application has the option to store results in a Lucene database, allowing complex queries. Otherwise, results will be pulled from the available search providers.

Formats: Search results must extend OC_Search_Result; public properties of the search result will be available in the search application. Also, the search application will call formatToHtml() prior to displaying any search result data, giving the developer a chance to add HTML to any properties.
Options: The Lucene database can be turned on and off from the 'Personal' tab. In the future, the search form will contain options to select result types.
Running time: Because indexing for the Lucene database may take some time, this is scheduled as a background task for ownCloud's 'cron' system.
Accuracy: not tests created at this time.

Developers: The main line of effort of the program is to pull search results from search providers and present them as HTML in a series of tables, one for each result type. The 'index.php' file handles this functionality with the help of the 'templates' files.

When using the Lucene database, results must first be indexed in the database; this ocurrs via hooks when an object is created, modified, deleted, etc. The hook functions add indexing to the queue of background tasks.
This project is still in beta testing.
